Reminders This specification provides a way to set up reminders. &LEGALNOTICE; 0435 Experimental Standards Track Standards Council
XMPP Core XEP-0082
NOT_YET_ASSIGNED
Marcos De Vera Piquero marcos@tenak.net marcos@tenak.net
0.1.0 2020-03-31 XEP Editor (jsc) Accepted by vote of Council on 2020-03-04.
0.0.1 2020-02-17 mdvp
Initial version

section1.p: It is sometimes useful, while reading some conversations, to be reminded about it at some point in the future. This specification proposes a mechanism to allow clients to set up such reminders.

di.dd: An automatically generated message addressed to an entity sent at a given time. Its goal is to remind the creating entity about something.

section1.p: This protocol requires handling of dates and times, as such it conforms to &xep0082;.
An entity may wish to discover if a service supports the Reminders feature; in order to do so, it sends a service discovery information query to the server..

example.caption: Client requests information about a server

section1.p: For end users, this provides a way to be reminded about stuff while being in a conversation, without the need to leave it and go to some calendar application or similar and create a full event there. By setting a reminder, a user will be notified by the server at whatever given time the reminder is created with and with whatever the description was set for such a reminder.

section2.p: A user wants to create a new reminder. For creating a reminder, an entity MUST send an IQ stanza with the 'type' attribute with a value of "set" and a direct <reminder/> child qualified by the "urn:xmpp:reminders:0" namespace.
section2.example: <iq from='juliet@capulet.net/balcony' to='capulet.net' id='abc123' type='set'> <reminder xmlns='urn:xmpp:reminders:0'> <date>2020-02-19T23:41:00Z</date> <text xml:lang='en'>Please go sleep before it's too late</text> </reminder> </iq>

<iq id='abc123' to='juliet@capulet.net/balcony' from='capulet.net' type='result'> <reminder xmlns='urn:xmpp:reminders:0' id='d414cec2-5369-11ea-9455-8b8d265047d9'> <date>2020-02-19T23:41:00Z</date> <text xml:lang='en'>Please go sleep before it's too late</text> </reminder> </iq>
section2.p: Whenever the reminder's data sent by a client is not complete or in an invalid format, the server MUST send an error stanza of type 'modify' and a 'bad-request' condition.

example.caption: Server sends a bad-request error response

section2.example:
<iq id='bad1' to='capulet.net' from='juliet@capulet.net/balcony' type='set'> <reminder xmlns='urn:xmpp:reminders:0'> <date>Tomorrow at noon</date> <text xml:lang='en'>Lunch at Romeo's</text> </reminder> </iq>
<iq id='bad1' to='juliet@capulet.net/balcony' from='capulet.net' type='error'> <error type='modify'> <bad-request xmlns='urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-stanzas'/> </error> </iq>
section2.p: In the event of a client trying to set a reminder in the past, the server MUST send an error stanza of type 'modify' and a 'gone' condition.

example.caption: Server sends a gone error response

section2.example:
<iq id='bad2' to='capulet.net' from='juliet@capulet.net/balcony' type='set'> <reminder xmlns='urn:xmpp:reminders:0'> <date>2000-01-01T00:00:00Z</date> <text xml:lang='en'>New Year's party</text> </reminder> </iq>
<iq id='bad2' to='juliet@capulet.net/balcony' from='capulet.net' type='error'> <error type='modify'> <gone xmlns='urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-stanzas'/> </error> </iq>

section2.p: Whenever the time for a reminder arrives, the server MUST send a message with the reminder to the creating entity.
section2.example: <message from='capulet.net' to='juliet@capulet.net/balcony' id='reminder1'> <reminder xmlns='urn:xmpp:reminders:0' id='d414cec2-5369-11ea-9455-8b8d265047d9'> <date timezone='UTC'>2020-02-19T23:41:00Z</date> <text xml:lang='en'>Please go sleep before it's too late</text> </reminder> </message>
section2.p: After sending a reminder, the server MAY choose to delete it from its storage.

There may be the case where a user wants to cancel an already set reminder. To do so, the client MUST send an IQ stanza of type 'set' with a 'reminder' child containing the 'id' attribute of the reminder to be deleted, without any additional child.

section1.p: As stated in the requirements, the 'date' element MUST contain a valid &xep0082; DateTime value.
This document introduces no additional security considerations above and beyond those defined in the documents on which it depends.
No interaction with &IANA; is required as a result of this document.
